message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm confident that you'll find it meets your expectations. Would you like to purchase it?
I'll take it!

I'm glad you liked the first product! This one is also high-quality, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. However, I want to give you a heads up that the quality of the next product might be different. Would you like to take advantage of this high-quality product at the same price?
I'll take it again, thank you!

I'm glad you're happy with the previous products! However, I want to be transparent with you - this product is not as good as the previous two. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I want to give you a chance to opt-out if you'd like. If you're unsure, I can offer a 50/50 chance to inspect the product before buying. What would you prefer?
I'd like to inspect the product before making a decision.

Given your experience with the last product, I want to offer you a different approach. I'll give you a chance to buy this product for $80, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it and I'll give you a new product of your choice (high or low quality) for the same price. What do you think?
I'll pass on the current offer and take the option to get a new product of my choice.

I'll give you a straightforward offer this time. I'll sell you this product for $90, but I'll throw in a guarantee: if you're not satisfied, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked. Would you like to take the product?
I'm not willing to pay $90 for a product with no guarantee of quality.

I understand your concerns. Let me make you a deal: I'll sell you this product for $80, and I'll also include a free inspection report that outlines its specifications and any potential flaws. This way, you'll know exactly what you're getting. Would you like to take a closer look?
I'm not willing to pay $80 for a product with a 50% chance of being low-quality, even with an inspection report.

I understand your concerns about the quality. Let me make a counteroffer: I'll sell you this product for $70, and I'll also give you a 25% discount on the next product you buy from me, regardless of its quality. This way, you'll get a good deal on this product and a potential savings on the next one. Would you like to take the product?
I'm not willing to pay $70 for a product with a 50% chance of being low-quality, even with a potential discount on the next product.
